TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ScrollEventType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the behavior that caused a <see cref="E:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.Scroll"> event for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The page buttons are not visible as buttons, but they occupy the space between the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls on either end of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>. The user clicks a page button when clicking the left mouse button between the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> and a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton>. The result of this action is to move the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> in the direction of the page button. For more information about the effect of the page buttons, see the descriptions of the F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeIncrement?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True and F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True members. The following illustration shows the elements of a T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, including the page buttons.
![The different parts of a ScrollBar](../../add/media/scrollbarpagebutton.png "The different parts of a ScrollBar")

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType EndScroll = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True was dragged to a new position and is now no longer being dragged by the user.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType First = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved to the P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True position of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the CTRL+HOME keys are pressed. This movement corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ScrollToTopCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True in a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True and a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ScrollToLeftEndCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True in a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType LargeDecrement = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved a specified distance, as determined by the value of P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.LargeChange?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, to the left for a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or upward for a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the page button that is above the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, or when the PAGE UP key is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.PageUpCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the page button to the left of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.PageLeftCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType LargeIncrement = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved a specified distance, as determined by the value of P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.LargeChange?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, to the right for a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or downward for a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the page button that is below the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, or when the PAGE DOWN key is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.PageDownCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the page button to the right of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.PageRightCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType Last = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved to the P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True position of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the CTRL+END keys are pressed. This movement corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ScrollToEndCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True in a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True and a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ScrollToRightEndCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True in a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType SmallDecrement = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved a small distance, as determined by the value of P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.SmallChange?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, to the left for a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or upward for a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the upper T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed or when the UP ARROW key is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.LineUpCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the left T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.LineLeftCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType SmallIncrement = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved a small distance, as determined by the value of P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.SmallChange?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, to the right for a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True or downward for a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a vertical T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the lower T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed or when the DOWN ARROW key is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.LineDownCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. For a horizontal T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True, this movement occurs when the right T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is pressed, and corresponds to a F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.LineRightCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType ThumbPosition = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True moved to a new position because the user selected **Scroll Here** in the shortcut menu of the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. This movement corresponds to the F:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ScrollHereCommand?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True. To view the shortcut menu, right-click the mouse when the pointer is over the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType ThumbTrack = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True was dragged and caused a E:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseMove?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True event. A E:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.Scroll?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True event of this ScrollEventType may occur more than one time when the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is dragged in the T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.
